thread.title: Can Past Market Corrections Hold Clues to What Lies Ahead?

author: Mike Bird
title: Can Past Market Corrections Hold Clues to What Lies Ahead?
text:
The first stock market correction in two years is prompting analysts and investors to look at previous collapses to glean what might come next.
The retreat in the Dow Jones Industrial Average marks the fifth time in the current bull market that U.S. stock indexes have suffered 10%-or-more declines. The others were in 2011, following the S&P Ratings Services downgrade of U.S. debt; in 2013, during the “taper tantrum” over Federal Reserve stimulus-reduction plans; in 2015, following the surprise devaluation of the Chinese...
